results.title: Australia
results.creator_credit: Richard Mason, Film Australia, Tourism Australia and Arch Nicholson
results.brief_description: A tourist promotion film showing all of the major regions of Australia. Includes fauna, recreation activities, natural features and urban scenes. Non-narrated. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Australasian Landforms (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This documentary shows the evolution of Australia, New Guinea and New Zealand over the last 2,000 million years ago. Animation is combined with aerial footage of the four main landform regions: The Western Shield, Central Basin, Eastern Highlands and the Island Arc from New Guinea to New Zealand.

results.title: Australasian landforms
results.creator_credit: Educational Media and Ken J. Widdowson
results.brief_description: Shows the effects of continental drift on the evolution of Australasia. Animation and aerial footage is used to show the features of the four major landform regions which make up present-day Australasia - The Western Shield, the Central Basins, the Eastern Highland and the Island Arc from New Guinea to New Zealand.

results.title: Austin Powers [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: New Line Cinema, Suzanne Todd, Demi Moore, Jennifer Todd, Mike Myers and Jay Roach
results.brief_description: Comedian Mike Myers (Wayne’s World) takes on the dual role of sixties super spy, renowned fashion photographer and insatiable casanova Austin Powers and his arch-enemy Dr Evil in this colourful parody of the James Bond films. Starting off in swinging London of the sixties, the film quickly moves into the present when Austin Powers must travel across time to stop Dr. Evil’s world conquering exploits, who has cryogenically frozen himself (and his cat Mr. Bigglesworth) and resurfaced in the nineties. Much of the films fish out of water humour is based on the difficulty Austin has in adjusting to a modern world that has little tolerance for a promiscuous, sexist, British secret agent with bad teeth and Dr Evil’s thwarted plans to outsmart a society that is far more advanced in notions of evil. Cast also includes Mimi Rogers, Elizabeth Hurley, Michael York and Robert Wagner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: New Line Cinema, Suzanne Todd, Demi Moore, Jennifer Todd, Mike Myers and Jay Roach

results.title: Auslang = Australian supply language
results.brief_description: About creating order from confusion and adapting a more disciplined approach to inventory identification in industry. Standard names are vital and AUSLANG (Australian Supply Language) offers a comprehensive dictionary together with colloquial cross references thus reducing the incidence of duplication of stock. AUSLANG was derived from the NATO codification system for Australian Industry use

results.title: Auslan for families: vocabulary. Episodes 1-5
results.creator_credit: Chisholm Institute Education Development Unit, VSDC Services for Deaf Children and Raffi Ghazarian
results.brief_description: Brian Bemal presents 5 episodes of Auslan signing pertaining to general conversation: family, school, shopping, food and play, with each episode building on the next. The video is accompanied by a guidebook containing pages from the VSDC “Dictionary of Auslan” from which the numbered signs are taken. Approximately 900 signs are shown. Suitable for beginners.

results.title: Aurora
results.creator_credit: David Taylor, Peter Jones and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Discovery”.
An investigation of the mystery surrounding the Aurora Borealis. An Australian physicist, Dr Robert Eather, at Boston College, Massachusetts has developed a method of filming the aurora in color.

results.title: Aunty Nancy and the easyplay
results.brief_description: Just released from a mental hospital for the 10th time, Aunty Nancy comes to stay with the relatives and our fearless narrator must vacate her room, again. Aunty Nancy can usually be tolerated, but only just. All that changes when she brings the easyplay - an electronic keyboard where she subjects them to a myriad of variations on “Chopsticks”.
